description: Among the Qing emperors, the Yongzheng emperor particularly valued decorative objects and personally oversaw the imperial kilns, setting exacting standards. These thin cups are a testament to his precise tastes. Delicate cobalt blue floral medallions filled with translucent enamels showcase the doucai technique. Different from typical Qing porcelains, these were perhaps influenced by Japanese lacquers imported in the 16th and 17th centuries.
title: Pair of Cups
